name: iO
description: iO is an abstract physics platformer about size and speed. Grow bigger and smaller in order to solve some of the trickiest puzzles. Reach the exit as quickly as possible and grab a gold medal as your reward!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP+ Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: DX9 (shader model 2.0) capabilities DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 250 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows XP+ Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: DX9 (shader model 2.0) capabilities DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 500 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Beautiful minimalistic graphics and audio, but most importantly, enjoyable and creative physics based puzzle platformer. Quite underappreciated for what it offers. In iO, you're a wheel, a very clever and fast wheel.

I'm usually not that much of a platformer person, but I liked the artstyle and music so much that I thought I'd give it a go. And well, the levels are very diverse in what they offer, and I'm having a blast so far. Especially the portal levels are great fun. Getting gold times is quite hard, and the game can be quite difficult as well, but if you're up for a challenge it can be very a rewarding experience :).

Dexterity and puzzling combined in one game! Think Trails Fusion in abstractform and add mind-boggling puzzlelevels. Some just come naturally and some make you facepalm for hours. Practice , rethink and master!  Btw, size does matter!
I gotta say. I really enjoy this game. It's addicting, intuitive and highly enjoyable!
OK, how the hell am I suppose to climb the wall effectively?
This is a seriously addictive game. Immersive soundtracks, and super challenging levels make definitely make this game worth its money.
Good game, Pretty challenging, love the game 10/5
A small casual dimensions logic game. Play with the size of your ball to get through the obstacles. It's okay.
